entry.title: 55,000 Berlin workers went on strike on 28 June 1916 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 55,000 Berlin workers went on strike on 28 June 1916 to protest the arrest and trial of anti-war campaigner Karl Liebknecht (pictured)?

entry.title: Derrick Palmer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Derrick Palmer and Chris Smalls, leaders of the Amazon Labor Union, were named two of the "100 most influential people in the world" in 2022?

entry.title: 1957 Mongolia earthquake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1957 Mongolia earthquake produced the world's best-preserved surface rupture of any great earthquake?

entry.title: Jean Holzworth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jean Holzworth obtained a PhD in Latin, then retrained as a veterinarian after one of her favorite cats died from a viral infection?

entry.title: a portrait of Edith Sitwell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Wyndham Lewis abandoned work on a portrait of Edith Sitwell from 1923 to 1935 after he failed to pay the rent for his studio?

entry.title: Erick Russell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Erick Russell is the first openly gay African American elected to a statewide office in the United States?

entry.title: Gastria (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gastria in Cyprus is "not old", but is home to Bronze Age tombs and a medieval castle?

entry.title: Cozmo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the robot Cozmo is said to have "felt like a real-life version of WALL·E"?
